result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lionel Colbert

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lionel Colbert appeared by video.  Attorney Morgan L. Minter appeared by video for Lionel Colbert.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Lionel Colbert in court.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Minter appears as friend of the court. 

Case in court for a status of counsel.   Defendant is not public defender eligible.  Defendant has not yet hired an attorney.  Court appointed Attorney Morgan Minter at County expense.  Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed by the Court.  Court ordered Mr. Colbert to pay back the county at $50.00 a month starting January 2023.  Court advised the defendant that all previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect, including NO POSSESSION of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 09-16-2022

Defendant Lionel Colbert in court, without counsel, out of custody.  Samuel E Simpson for Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom.
Case in court for indigency hearing.  Defendant is not public defender eligible.  Defendant is working on hiring an attorney and needs more time.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Lionel Colbert in court in person.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-03-2022
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Donna B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Lionel Colbert in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Lionel Colbert in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lionel Colbert appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
